body_html:
Well, the first thing that comes to mind is that because FreeBSD is similar to OS X, most probably there must be some checks for it in the *.cc codes.
For example, quick grep find shows that this line might need an include for BSD or any other supported Unix system check in addition to __APPLE__.

I guess the documentation will also need addition of other OSs. For example, on some compilers, libdl is part of libc, which means that a quick hack might be required (like ln -s libc.so libdl.so)

There might be more -- I am just sticking to using TF on OS X for now :)

body:
Well, the first thing that comes to mind is that because `FreeBSD` is similar to OS X, most probably there must be some checks for it in the `*.cc` codes. 
For example, quick grep find shows that [this line](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/73bc42890/tensorflow/stream_executor/rng.cc#L44) might need an include for `BSD` or any other supported Unix system check in addition to `__APPLE__`. 

I guess the documentation will also need addition of other OSs. For example, on some compilers, `libdl` is part of `libc`, which means that a quick hack might be required (like `ln -s libc.so libdl.so`)

There might be more -- I am just sticking to using TF on OS X for now :)
